name: Huacheng Yu
content: Huacheng Yu's Homepage Huacheng Yu Assistant Professor Department of Computer Science Princeton University Email: yuhch123#gmail#com Office: 35 Olden St, Office 310 Research / Teaching / Service / CV / Google scholar I am an assistant professor in the Department of Computer Science at Princeton University. I was an associate research scholar in the department of computer science at Princeton University from 2019 to 2021. Prior to Princeton, I was a postdoc in the Theory of Computation group at Harvard University hosted by Jelani Nelson and Madhu Sudan. I did my PhD at Stanford University, where I was fortunate to have Ryan Williams and Omer Reingold as my advisers. Prior to that, I received my bachelor's degree from Yao Class at Tsinghua University. My main research interests include data structures and streaming algorithms, and I am also interested in other directions in theory, including communication complexity and graph algorithms. Current students Elena Gribelyuk (2022-) Pachara Sawettamalya (2022-) Research Teaching Fall 2025: Advanced Algorithm Design Spring 2025: Algorithms and Data Structures (Advanced Precept) Fall 2024: Recent Advances in Graph Algorithms Fall 2023: Advanced Algorithm Design Spring 2023: IW Seminar: Data structures, IW Seminar: Streaming algorithms Fall 2022: Advanced Algorithm Design Fall 2021: Streaming and Sketching Algorithms Service I am/was on the PODS 2026, SODA 2026, FOCS 2024, SODA 2024, STOC 2023, ESA 2021, STOC 2021, FOCS 2019, ISAAC 2018, COCOON 2017 and COCOA 2017 PC. Last update: 2025/9. Template adapted from Danqi Chen's.
